Get started

Gerald H. Taranto

Thu 10, March, 2022

Source: vignettes/articles/get_st.Rmd
get_st.Rmd

Working example articles

The working example articles provide provide a general overview of the package capabilities. They show how scapesClassification can be used to classify marine seafloor structures (geomorphic management units - GMUs)

The GMU-classification will be presented in five separate articles:

  1. Format input data;

  2. Island shelf unit (ISU);

  3. Local maxima on gridded data;

  4. Independent objects on raster surfaces;

  5. Borders of raster objects.

In scapesClassification there are four groups of functions:

  • Format input functions are used to format the spatial layers provided by users and make them available to other package functions;

  • Helper functions are used to help users handle classification vectors and condition strings;

  • Classification functions are used to identify anchor locations and classify raster cells based on targeted evaluations of user-defined classification rules;

  • Raster object functions are used to identify and manipulate raster objects.

Developed by Gerald H. Taranto.
